Question
========

$\begin{aligned} A & = \left \{ x \mid x = 2k, k \in Z \right
\}\\ B & = \left \{ x \mid x = 2k + 1, k \in Z \right \}\\ C
& = \left \{ x \mid x = 2(k + 1), k \in Z \right \}\\ D & =
\left \{ x \mid x = 2k - 1, k \in Z \right \} \end{aligned}$

where Z is the set of all the integers (positive and negative) numbers, including 0. If each time two sets make a cross section then which one yields an empty set?

Answerlist
----------

* $A \cap B = \varnothing, A \cap C = \varnothing, C \cap B = \varnothing, C \cap D = \varnothing$
* $A \cap D = \varnothing, A \cap C = \varnothing, C \cap B = \varnothing, C \cap D = \varnothing$
* $A \cap B = \varnothing, A \cap C = \varnothing, B \cap D = \varnothing, C \cap B = \varnothing$
* $A \cap B = \varnothing, A \cap D = \varnothing, C \cap B = \varnothing, C \cap D = \varnothing$

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* $A \cap B = \varnothing, A \cap C = \varnothing, C \cap B = \varnothing, C \cap D = \varnothing$: Correct
* $A \cap D = \varnothing, A \cap C = \varnothing, C \cap B = \varnothing, C \cap D = \varnothing$: Incorrect
* $A \cap B = \varnothing, A \cap C = \varnothing, B \cap D = \varnothing, C \cap B = \varnothing$: Incorrect
* $A \cap B = \varnothing, A \cap D = \varnothing, C \cap B = \varnothing, C \cap D = \varnothing$: Incorrect
